post.body: Summit, what would you like to know about the project at my website? email at 99jkresge@jamestown.wnyric.org
reviewbasics - So a kid creates a word document, email it to us, and then how do we apply the site. I don't quite get it.
I was referring to photosynth. Sorry for not including that in my original post.
This is unreal. Microsoft leads the way? Miracles never cease.
Gave US citizen test 2day to intro Constitution(http://tinyurl.com/6e2jtg)/YouTube of 2yr old reciting Preamble
rejoicing in the fact I got to shower at home this morning. We've had no water since last Wednesday - pipe burst New Years Eve.
There is a lesson in these images somewhere -http://tinyurl.com/5awa7v
Here is the link -http://change.gov/
found this link about Obama's transition. Well done. By the way, Obama plans to broadcast weekly addresses at YouTube.
Found this while playing with Diigo - this could only lead to trouble - http://beta.twiddeo.com/
Check this out for grading kid's digital work. Need to look into Diigo. http://tinyurl.com/7h6jr4
Been thinking about how to get hired by districts to do consulting. Can WSTCSS create a list of presentations by our people?
Animations of war maps - very cool - http://www.mapsofwar.com/
Trying to create ways to make social studies more discovery based for the rest of the year. Starting the Constitution on Monday. Ideas?
Hanging out with a an old teacher friend from Wisconsin. He is an ELA guy but interested in our group - Twitter name is pwarloski.
Just to let you all know, Jayme (new guy) is now Twittering with us. http://twitter.com/jgenco
Sorry - Wrong electoral college link - try this and click listen now. http://tinyurl.com/5ulnjt
After looking at the options, I think it would be easiest to have our web guru create @wstcss.org email addresses for us and yammer.
Heard this yesterday NPR - the push to change the electoral college. Good stuff. http://bit.ly/Ipff
I'm of to Buffalo for Sabres vs. the hated Leafs. Lets go Buffalo!
